choices.text: clinical trial is conducted to compare the efficacy of drug A and drug B on lowering blood pressure. Participants are randomly divided into two groups. One group is given drug A and the other drug B. The average reduction in blood pressure after taking the drug is measured and compared between the two groups. Assuming the distributional assumptions hold, the paired-sample t-test is appropriate in the above scenario (instead of the independent-sample t-test).
